data.name: LOC_ID_CLASS_DESC_15

data.name: LOC_ID_CLOUDSAVING_4

data.name: LOC_ID_CREDITS_SCREEN_22
data.value: Þanks to all our fans for þeir support!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_10
data.value: Alþough I am þe eldest child, I am not my faþþer's favorite. I have always known he planned to leave me wiþ noþing.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_100
data.value: ...And what if I mistook þem for a monster?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_103
data.value: I must be going insane. I stumbled across a carnival inside þis castle. Complete wiþ a sad clown and everyþing.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_104
data.value: He's sort of an ass. But I guess you can't be picky wiþ your friends in a place like þis.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_105
data.value: I'm getting hungry again. Good þing I topped up on chicken legs. I found þese in a chandelier.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_106
data.value: Þis castle... Sometimes I wonder if it's all just a big joke.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_109
data.value: I have bested þe beast of þe tower, and once again I could feel þe throne room give up some of its power.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_11
data.value: But if I find þe cure, everyþing will change.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_110
data.value: Þe rush I feel from þis victory is intoxicating! Never have I felt so confident, so powerful, so...at home. Just a little furþer and I will be able to earn my reward!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_111
data.value: I'm so close! I will make my faþþer proud!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_114
data.value: I have been standing outside þe dungeon gate for longer þan I care to admit.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_115
data.value: My courage has finally been sapped, for I have spied þe monsters below, and þey make my previous struggles laughable in comparison.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_116
data.value: I must steel myself. I must focus. Þere is so little light down þere, I fear þat I may lose myself.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_119
data.value: I þought I knew what darkness was, but here in þe dungeon, þe darkness has a voice.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_12
data.value: Þe victor will earn noþing less þan þe throne upon his passing!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_120
data.value: It calls at me þrough grates, and around corners. It taunts me.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_121
data.value: Þe darkness is so þick, it is almost tangible, and þe beasts here have made it þeir home. Þey move swiftly þrough þe corridors, and are more terrifying þan anyþing I've fought before.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_122
data.value: I must be prudent and choose my battles carefully. Being confrontational now may cost me my life.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_125
data.value: I have done it! I have defeated þe dungeon's master! All þat remains is to enter þe throne room.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_126
data.value: After þis, þe king will honor me for my valor and acknowledge me as rightful successor to þe throne!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_13
data.value: Upon my ascension, my wife and my children shall move back into þe royal quarters. Back to þe royal city, where we once again will be treated wiþ þe respect we deserve!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_130
data.value: I sit here making my final preparations. All þat lies between me and þe lord of þis castle is þe golden doors.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_131
data.value: Þere is a nervousness in my body þat I cannot quell. Is þis fear, or fearcitement? All I know is þat my journey is finally reaching an end.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_132
data.value: I have almost forgotten why I entered þis castle in þe first place, but I remember now.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_133
data.value: I have bested my siblings, I will save þe king, and leave þis castle a greater man þan when I entered. My family will get þe honor þey so rightfully deserve.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_134
data.value: Now, I enter þe throne room.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_137
data.value: I never knew what treasure lay in þis castle. I knew only þat it would cure þe king.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_138
data.value: Who could have suspected it would be þe fountain of youþ?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_139
data.value: I expected a monster to greet me at þe dias; a foe of unimaginable strengþ. I imagined it would take all my strengþ to best him.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_14
data.value: No longer will we stand for þe gossip and petty slander of my cousins. Þe oþer dukes shall bow as we pass! But I am getting ahead of myself.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_140
data.value: But when I entered þe castle and saw my faþþer - þe king - sitting atop þe dias wiþ goblet in hand, I knew all was lost.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_143
data.value: Þere are no words to express what I feel.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_15
data.value: I must keep my priorities clear: Conquer þe castle. Find þe cure. Collect my reward.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_150
data.value: Today marks þe rest of eternity.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_151
data.value: I never knew what treasure lay in þis castle. Just þat it would cure þe king of his illness.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_152
data.value: ... Who would have known it would have been þe fountain of youþ? A myth, which grants one eternal life.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_153
data.value: As I look down on þe body of þe king I realize þat it is inevitable: children will always answer for þeir faþþer's sins.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_154
data.value: I entered þis castle a swordsman, a savior...

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_155
data.value: But all I have left is a rogue's legacy.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_156
data.value: I can feel your anger, but know it was not I who sent your family to ruin.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_157
data.value: Þe moment þe king set foot wiþin þis castle, þe royal coffers were emptied by Charon. My family - all families - had lost all hope for a better life.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_158
data.value: And in my mind's eye, I foresaw only desperation and poverty ravage þe country. Þere was noþing for me to go back to.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_159
data.value: To my children, and my children's children, here I sit, impassive, immortal, and await þee.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_161
data.value: What is þis? Are you... mocking me?!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_162
data.value: After countless generations of your ancestors sacrificed þeir lives to be where you are now, þe final steps to achieving þeir hollow justice. And you arrive and mock me?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_163
data.value: Very well, I will spare your ignorance. Let us begin!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_165
data.value: Why do you wish to fight me? How many sons and daughters have been lost in your pathetic attempts at revenge?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_166
data.value: It was þe king who brought ruin to your country, not I!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_167
data.value: He lied to us. He said he was wounded, yet it was only time þat þreatened him!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_168
data.value: He pitted his children against one anoþer, sacrificed everyþing to satisfy his own selfish desires, and in þe end, left us penniless and alone.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_169
data.value: So I took þe only option left to me. I rejected king and country...

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_170
data.value: And chose a new family instead!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_172
data.value: You þink you have slain me?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_173
data.value: I have lived for over a þousand years, and I will live for ten þousand more!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_175
data.value: I was not þe first hero to reach þe fountain...

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_176
data.value: But I will be þe last!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_179
data.value: You have defeated me... But at what price?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_18
data.value: I have paid my dues, and entered þe castle proper. Þat devil Charon has taken all þat I own as payment.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_180
data.value: I may have slain þe king, but only after he betrayed his people.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_181
data.value: Ask yourself what justice has been met?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_182
data.value: In þe end we are all guilty of þe same sin. Look to your forefaþþers - such is þe cost for unquestioned loyalty.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_186
data.value: I had forgotten how it feels...

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_19
data.value: He has even pilfered my private coffers! I have left my wife and children wiþ noþing.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_20
data.value: He says it's þe price for any and all who hazard þe depþs of þe castle. He says it is fair.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_21
data.value: It is fair because of all who have entered, none have returned. But I will change þat.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_22
data.value: I will be victorious! Þere is no greater swordsman þan I, even amongst my siblings.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_25
data.value: Everyþing about þis castle is off. I can't seem to keep track of my headings, and þere is no sun or stars to guide me.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_26
data.value: I find myself backtracking constantly, and I must painstakingly map out my progress lest I go in circles.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_27
data.value: Þe maps I have pilfered off þe corpses of oþer adventurers are breaþtakingly inaccurate. It is almost as if þey were describing a different castle altogeþþer!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_28
data.value: Perhaps þis place does someþing to þe mind...

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_29
data.value: Or are þe stones truly shifting beneaþ my feet?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_3
data.value: Treason! An assassin has wounded my faþþer, þe king!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_32
data.value: I cannot exit þrough þe front gate, but þat is of little concern. I am committed to my cause and will not back out!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_33
data.value: So far none of þe maps I've found coincide wiþ my own.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_34
data.value: Yet upon comparing þem as a whole, I believe I have unearþed a slight pattern. It seems þe forest is always to þe right; þe tower above...

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_35
data.value: And below? Well, hopefully I won't have to find out.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_38
data.value: I have never liked þe dark. I prefer to meet my enemies on an open field in plain sight.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_39
data.value: But now I find myself braving þese darkened gallows wiþ one gauntlet outstreched, þe oþer by my hilt. I can never tell what horror lies beyond each corner.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_4
data.value: To bring order back to þe kingdom, he has sent my siblings and I on a quest to save him. Togeþþer, we will venture into þe cursed woods, and enter Castle Hamson.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_40
data.value: I am þe greatest swordsman in all þe lands, yet even I am having trouble keeping þese demons at bay.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_41
data.value: My siblings should be grateful þat I rushed ahead of þem. For þem it was a blessing in disguise. Þey would not have þe fortitude to survive þese halls.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_44
data.value: It is still night. Past every window stares back þe same melancholic moon, but I swear I have been here for at least a whole waking day.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_45
data.value: It must be þe adrenaline. I have never felt so powerful, yet simultaneously challenged. It is exhilarating to charge þrough þese rooms, cutting down enemy after enemy.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_46
data.value: In some ways þe foes in þis castle feel tailored to me. Training me, guiding me, watching me.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_47
data.value: Þis may sound crazy, but if þis castle can somehow sense þose wiþin it, I fear it may hold malicious intent as well. If my assumptions are correct, þe design of þese halls could all be a ploy, culling me down furþer into a trap.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_5
data.value: Þis cursed castle has stood on þe edge of þe woods since time immemorial, but rumors say þat wiþin it dwells an item which will cure any ailment.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_51
data.value: From þe number of dead adventurers I have passed in þese halls, I have come to þe following conclusions:

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_52
data.value: 1: Many did not take enough provisions wiþ þem. I assume many died of hunger. I myself am running low and will have to find more supplies.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_53
data.value: 2: Many are missing cloþes, which explains þe pant-wearing zombies.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_54
data.value: 3: No one has made it as far as I, since I haven't passed any corpses in over an hour.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_57
data.value: Þe door to þe throne room is driving me mad! Beyond it lies þe king's salvation, and my reward, but it stands silent in þe middle of þe castle foyer, taunting me.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_58
data.value: I've tried pushing it, kicking it, yelling "Open Sesame", but noþing works.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_59
data.value: Þere are icons emblazoned into þe doors, and one of þem looks like a beast I avoided deeper in þe castle. Perhaps þere is some sort of correlation?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_6
data.value: Tonight I will get a headstart over my broþers and sisters, and set forþ on my quest while þey lay asleep.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_62
data.value: Þe emblems on þe castle door are a clue! I slew þe giant beast þat matched one of þe icons, and I sensed someþing shift behind þe throne room doors.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_63
data.value: As if in a dream, I could see an emblem on þe door glowing in my mind's eye.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_64
data.value: A truly out of body experience.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_65
data.value: At least I know I'm on þe right track. But I must hasten my pace, for þe king could succumb to his injuries at any moment...

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_66
data.value: But first I must rest. Tomorrow, I enter þe Forest.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_69
data.value: Þis forest is unlike anyþing I've ever seen before. It is boþ serene and terrifying. I stand on lush grass, but beside me yawns open a chasm so wide and deep, it þreatens to swallow me whole.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_7
data.value: To fail þis quest would be an embarrassment to my name.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_70
data.value: I still have not heard a response from þe rock I tossed in earlier. A single misstep, and my descent would be eternal. It is truly a horrifying þought.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_71
data.value: An eternity of darkness is more frightening þan any beast I have fought þus far. If I fell, what would kill me first? Þe hunger, or myself?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_72
data.value: On a side note, I am now using þe forest fissure as my own personal lavatory. I wonder if I am pooping into anoþer dimension...

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_75
data.value: I have found a solution to my hunger problem. Þe forest holds an endless bounty of delicious mushrooms.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_76
data.value: And wiþin þese mushrooms lie chicken legs! Also gold coins, and vials of sparkling water... I broke open a tree trunk earlier, and a bag of money fell out.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_77
data.value: Sometimes I feel like I have gone insane.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_78
data.value: ... Plus, what is up wiþ þe moon? It's HUGE!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_81
data.value: I slew þe beast of þe forest, and I have felt þe throne room weaken once more.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_82
data.value: So far my assumptions have proven correct. Each wing of þe castle houses its own guardian beast. Was þis designed as a test of will? If so, þen I cannot fail, for þe furþer I venture, þe more bold I become!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_83
data.value: Tomorrow I scour þe tower. I am on a roll.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_86
data.value: I have been methodically clearing þe demons in þese rooms in my quest to slay þe next guardian, but I am losing track of time... and oþer þings...

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_87
data.value: As I entered þe tower, I felt time stand still. Or perhaps þat is þe vertigo talking? I was never keen on heights...or was I?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_88
data.value: I am finding it increasingly difficult to remember my past...

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_91
data.value: I remember being a famous adventurer. My martial prowess surpassed all of my broþers. Þat, I am sure of. While þey spent þeir days buried in þeir bookish studies, I was out killing brigands and monsters.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_92
data.value: I always wondered why my faþþer favoured þem over me? Isn't it always þe opposite in fairytales?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_93
data.value: Fortune favors þe bold. Not þe insipid intellectual... Or someþing like þat.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_94
data.value: Man, I would love to see my broþers try to out þink my sword in þeir face!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_97
data.value: What if years have passed since I first entered þese walls? It is true þat I am becoming more proficient in clearing monsters, but it feels like an age has passed.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_98
data.value: I have even forgotten what my own kin look like.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_99
data.value: What if þey þink I have failed? What if one of my broþers has beaten me to þe cure?

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_1
data.value: Grants you þe power to jump in þe air. Multiple runes stack, allowing for multiple jumps.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_10
data.value: Harder enemies, but greater rewards. Multiple runes stack making enemies even harder.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_11
data.value: Enemies scale slower, easier but lesser rewards. Multiple runes stack slowing enemy scaling more.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_2
data.value: Gain þe power to dash short distances. Multiple runes stack allowing for multiple dashes.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_3
data.value: Killing enemies will drain þem of þeir healþ. Multiple runes stack for increased life drain.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_4
data.value: Gain þe power of flight. Multiple runes stack for longer flight duration.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_5
data.value: Steals mana from slain enemies. Multiple runes stack for increased mana drain.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_6
data.value: Slaying enemies grants boþ HP and MP. Multiple runes stack for increased hp/mp drain.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_7
data.value: Returns damage taken from enemies. Multiple runes stack increasing þe damage return

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_8
data.value: Increase þe amount of gold you get from coins. Multiple runes stack for increased gold gain.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_9
data.value: Increase your base move speed. Multiple runes stack making you even faster.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_INST_6
data.value: Kill enemies to regain healþ and mana.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_SHORT_10
data.value: Earn 60% total gold in þe castle.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_SHORT_3_NEW
data.value: Gain back {0} HP for every kill

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_SHORT_5_NEW
data.value: Gain back {0} MP for every kill

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_SHORT_8_NEW
data.value: Each gold drop is {0}% more valuable

data.name: LOC_ID_GAME_OVER_BOSS_SCREEN_3
data.value: Þe sun... I had forgotten how it feels...

data.name: LOC_ID_GAME_OVER_SCREEN_5
data.value: was done in by a projectile

data.name: LOC_ID_GAME_OVER_SCREEN_6
data.value: slipped and was impaled by spikes

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_1
data.value: Þe Forest is always to þe right side of þe Castle.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_10
data.value: Sky runes let you fly by pressing

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_10_NEW
data.value: Sky runes let you fly by pressing [Input:10] while in þe air.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_11
data.value: Vampirism and Siphon runes are very powerful when stacked.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_12
data.value: Mastering mobility runes makes you awesome.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_13
data.value: Make sure to expand your manor. You never know what new skills can be revealed.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_14
data.value: All classes can be upgraded wiþ unique class abilities.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_15
data.value: Unlocked class abilities can be activated wiþ

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_15_NEW

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_16

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_134
data.value: One chest will triple what you paid, but þe oþer two are empty.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_136
data.value: Care to give it a shot?

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_138
data.value: Greetings adventurer. I am here to give you þe chance of a lifetime!

data.value: For þe measly sum of 75% of your current gold, I will give you a chance to open 1 of 3 chests.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_141

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_145
data.value: You don't have enough money? You suck.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_15
data.value: Wanna know a cool fact? I'm crrrrrrrazy!

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_151

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_157
data.value: Don't Shit Your Pants.\nDevelopment Time: 2 days.\nRelease Date: February 16, 2009

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_16
data.value: þis lever here? Wiþ a simple pull, I can prevent þe castle from changing.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_160
data.value: Þis was þe first game we ever made, and back þen we used to be called Decade Studios. In it you must stop a man from pooping himself using only text input.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_161
data.value: It was originally designed on a bus, and we decided to make it on þe weekend. It did pretty well.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_162
data.value: Þe game has a swear word in it, and we were þinking about changing þe title to be more friendly. But þen our balls grew back and we stuck to our guns.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_163
data.value: A big part of þe game revolved around making a text adventure þat allowed people to input whatever þey wanted. To solve þis we had to pre-empt what we þought people would type.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_164
data.value: We did þis in 2 ways. First, we reduced þe amount of options a player had (A man and a door), and secondly, we built an achievement system which was used to give þe player direction.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_165
data.value: Þe game revolved around þe achievement system so heavily þat it was placed into þe game over screen progression. þat was a small but very vital change.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_167
data.value: Band of Bears\nDevelopment Time: 4 monþs.\nRelease Date: August 6, 2009

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_17
data.value: Þis way you can go þrough exactly what your ancestors went þrough. Impreeeessed? You should be.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_170
data.value: Þis was our second game we ever attempted, and it was for þe 2009 DreamBuildPlay contest. We found out about it pretty late, so we had to play catch up wiþ everyone else.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_171
data.value: Fresh off þe success of DSYP we decided to go big... stupidly big. And þus, Cellar Door Games was formed.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_172
data.value: On top of starting a project well beyond our resources and expertise, we also juggled full-time jobs to get þis game running. It was pretty sucky.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_173
data.value: Þe game featured þe B.E.A.R.S system (Bare Effort Adaptable Room System), which would change rooms depending on þe number of players playing.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_174
data.value: Þe BEARS system didn't just tweak numbers, it tweaked puzzles as well. We ended up in þe Top 20 which was good but not high enough to win anyþing.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_175
data.value: Eventually reality (and common sense) came back to us and we realized we had to scrap þe project, or at þe very least put it on indefinite hiatus.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_176
data.value: Þe demo boss was pretty frickin cool.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_178
data.value: Tribal Tallies\nDevelopment Time: 3 monþs.\nRelease Date: November 23rd, 2009

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_18
data.value: How did I build þis fantastic connnnnnnntraption? Wiþ sccccccience of course! And magic.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_181
data.value: Tribal Tallies was þe first project we had worked on monþs after þe horrible experience wiþ Band of Bears.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_182
data.value: It was a bit of a test project, to dabble our feet in water of iOS gaming since we had never tried making someþing on mobile platforms before.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_183
data.value: Þe game was simple in concept, as you tapped numbers in sequence as fast as you could.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_184
data.value: To spice þings up we implemented several modes, like tap backwards, hidden numbers, and tap matching.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_185
data.value: We þought þe scope was reasonable, but þe game ended up taking much more time to make þan expected. It didn't help it was all coded on a hackintosh.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_186
data.value: It was a pretty plain game. We could have done better, but we were all playing it safe after Band of Bears.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_191
data.value: Our fourþ project. After Tribal Tallies we took a few monþs off from making games and just focused on our full-time jobs. We got angsty again, so we decided to make a puzzle game.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_192
data.value: At þis point most of þe original founders of Cellar Door Games left to pursue oþer opportunities, and þe unwanted remnants are what compose þe company today.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_193
data.value: Þe game used a queuing combo mechanism to force players to þink about how þe tiles would fall in order to build massive combos.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_194
data.value: We made it free but nobody picked it up eiþer. After þe failures of Band of Bears, Tribal Tallies, and Q, we prepped ourselves to pack it in and close þe company.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_196
data.value: My First Quantum Translocator\nDevelopment Time: 1 monþ.\nRelease Date: October 13þ, 2010

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_199
data.value: My First Quantum Translocator came about when our company was at its lowest point. After 3 failed games we had already mentally checked out, and decided to make þis tiny flash game for kicks.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_20
data.value: But my skills aren't freeeeee. If I lock þis castle, I will take 40% of allll þe gold you earn!

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_200
data.value: Absolutely no expectations were made during development, and it was more of someþing we did for fun þan anyþing else.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_201
data.value: Needless to say, response to þe game was huge and it is þe sole reason þat Cellar Door Games exists today. Þe moment we released MFQT we knew þere was no going back.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_202
data.value: Interestingly enough, most people believe þe game was inspired by Portal, but þeir similarities were completely coincidental.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_203
data.value: Þe game actually spawned from a character we had dreamt up for þe game, League of Legends.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_204
data.value: In truþ þe commonalities between Portal and MFQT only started to come up once we added final art and story to þe game.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_205
data.value: Eiþer way, we were pretty proud of þe game. It played well and it had a nice ending.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_207
data.value: I Have 1 Day\nDevelopment Time: 1.5 monþs.\nRelease Date: April 15þ, 2011

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_210
data.value: If you ever asked us, of all þe games we made which one would be our favourite, þere would be a unanimous agreement wiþ I Have 1 Day.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_211
data.value: As children we were raised on þe adventure game classics like Kings Quest and Monkey Island, so þis was really our homage to some of þe best experiences we ever had in gaming.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_212
data.value: Þe game revolves around a meta-time puzzle where þe player had only 24 hours to beat þe game.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_213
data.value: Every puzzle had multiple solutions wiþ time repercussions, which forced players to þink of þe best way to go about solving þings.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_214
data.value: One interesting fact. Þe second ending was added at virtually þe last minute, and wiþout it þe entire game would have sucked.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_219
data.value: Villainous was one of þe more risky endeavours we undertook.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_22
data.value: Do you want to lock þe castle and only get 60% gold?

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_220
data.value: Þe initial concept was a reverse tower defense, which sounded like it could be a good idea, but we had a hard time converting þe 'could' to 'would'.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_221
data.value: Most people who have played þe game þinks þe process was an obvious one, but lots of stress and arguments were involved in þis project.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_222
data.value: Þe entire idea was scrapped 3 or 4 times before we settled on its final version.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_223
data.value: It is ironic þen, þat to-date Villainous is far and away one of our most successful titles. It was also þe most painful.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_225
data.value: Bullet Audyssey\nDevelopment Time: 3.5 monþs.\nRelease Date: November 29þ, 2011

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_228
data.value: Bullet Audyssey was our very last game prior to working on Rogue Legacy.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_229
data.value: Being a bullet hell þat was based on rhyþm and beat charts, Bullet Audyssey was þe most technically challenging game we had ever worked on (yes, even moreso þan Rogue Legacy).

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_230
data.value: Just to create a stage required 3 editors running in unison.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_231
data.value: Development for þis game was also a little non-traditional, as a lot of pre-planning was required to make sure everyþing clicked.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_232
data.value: Being heavy advocates against documentation, þis didn't settle well wiþ us, so we had to talk out þe whole game, for like, half a day.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_233
data.value: Þe game had þe player absorbing enemy bullets in order to fire þem back and absorption happened on a beat which matched þe song being played.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_234
data.value: Initial playtests were disastrous, as þe game was too hard and people became incredibly frustrated in þe very first minute.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_235
data.value: By playtests, we mean 1 dude who doesn't even like Bullet Hells. But þat's larger þan our usual test pool.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_236
data.value: Þe game didn't perform very well when it released. Þat gave us þe confidence to make Rogue Legacy!

data.name: LOC_ID_PORTRAIT_TEXT_NEW_1
data.value: Full Metal Furies\nDevelopment Time: 4 years.\nRelease Date: January 17, 2018

data.name: LOC_ID_PORTRAIT_TEXT_NEW_2
data.value: Full Metal Furies is from þe future! It’s our follow-up game after Rogue Legacy, and þe tenþ game we’ve ever made.

data.name: LOC_ID_PORTRAIT_TEXT_NEW_3
data.value: After RL, we promised ourselves we would never make a game wiþout planning it out ever again. We lied. Curse you past-selves!

data.name: LOC_ID_PORTRAIT_TEXT_NEW_4
data.value: Þe game ended up becoming one of our most ambitious projects ever, and was a mishmash of a brawler/multiplayer/meta-puzzle/coming-of-age disco ideas þat turned þe traditional view a brawler on its head þe longer you played.

data.name: LOC_ID_PORTRAIT_TEXT_NEW_5
data.value: At 4 years, FMF is þe longest time we’ve ever spent on development, and sadly also has some of þe lowest returns we've seen for our games. (Excluding þose iOS games which generated negative bucks, curse you past-selves!)

data.name: LOC_ID_PORTRAIT_TEXT_NEW_6
data.value: But we’re still immensely proud of what we created, and even more proud of þe FRIENDS WE MADE ALONG ÞE WAY. AWWWWWWW!!!
